text: Hello! I'm trying to use the enrollment trigger for *invalid email address*, but I can't find a definition within the knowledge base other than "whether the email address is invalid." Does HubSpot calculate this based on a set of criteria, and if so, what is it?

Hello! Is it possible to have a personalization token within an automated email referencing an associated contact record property? I have an automated email in a workflow from a custom object, but I need to pull in property from the contacts object for personalization. Based on this support post (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Personalization-tokens-with-associated-objects-in-emails/m-p/396187>), it seems possible, but I'm not sure how to find the ID for my contacts object table or how to re-write the statement: {{ p7099483_<http://contact.email/|Contact.email> }} to include it.
I'd like to host my blog on my own.  Is it possible to have an email from HubSpot automatically be sent when the blog post is published -- via RSS Feed or API?!
The solution here may help explain a little bit: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CRM/Import-to-or-update-Invalid-Email-Address/m-p/422145>
Is there a way to determine which Internal HubSpot ID matches a unique email and workflow combination?
Is the email using the drag-and-drop editor? I know with coded email you can output some behind the scenes info, and that might surface the object ID.
Are you asking where to find the emailâ€™s internal ID?
